description.narrative: The proposed project will consist of IFCs equity investment of up to MNT10.4 billion (US$7.5 million equivalent) in Tenger Financial Group (TFG or the Company), an existing equity investee company of IFC, by purchasing from the existing shareholders. TFG, established in 2001 on the base of its major subsidiary XacBank, is a Mongolian financial group offering a full range of financial services. Its major subsidiaries include XacBank (comprising nearly 96% of its total assets), XacLeasing, Tenger Insurance, TenGer Capital (brokerage and investment advisory services), XacSecurity (premium quality security services), Tenger Solutions (mobile banking solutions in house developer) and Xinjiang Tianrong Micro Credit Company (Xinjiang MCC, a company based in western China). IFC started its long term partnership with TFG in 1999, with an advisory program to X.A.C. LLC, one of the predecessors of XacBank, and became a shareholder of the Company in 2008. IFCs further increasing stake in TFG through the proposed investment, will demonstrate confidence in both the Company and the Mongolian financial market, will provide comfort to the new strategic international investor, and will help the Company to achieve a more balanced shareholding structure and a more transparent corporate governance, which will constitute strong basis for the Companys future development.

i) To support the development of Mongolian financial sector: through the proposed investment, IFC will help a systemically important financial institution of Mongolia to introduce a strategic international investor and to achieve a more balanced and transparent shareholding structure, which will become a strong basis for the Company''s further development and will also benefit the further development of the Mongolian financial sector; and ii) To promote better corporate governance among Mongolian corporations: after the completion of the transaction, Tenger Financial Group will achieve a more transparent corporate governance, which will have strong demonstration effect to other Mongolian corporations and will promote the improvement of their corporate governance.

name.narrative: TFG is headquartered in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Its largest subsidiary XacBank, representing 96% of its total assets, is also headquartered in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia, with a total of over 90 branches and outlets around the country. Most of its other operational subsidiaries are all headquartered in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia, except for that Xinjiang Tianrong Micro Credit Co., Ltd is headquartered in Urumqi, China.
